member.summary: A static class to show ChildWindow's

member.name: T:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.OverlayFillBehavior

member.name: F:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.OverlayFillBehavior.FullWindow
member.summary: The overlay covers the full window

member.name: M:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.ShowChildWindowAsync(System.Windows.Window,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindow,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.OverlayFillBehavior)
member.summary: Shows the given child window on the MetroWindow dialog container in an asynchronous way.
member.param: The owning window with a container of the child window.
member.exception: The provided child window can not add, the container can not be found. or The provided child window is already visible in the specified window.

member.name: M:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.ShowChildWindowAsync``1(System.Windows.Window,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindow,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.OverlayFillBehavior)
member.summary: Shows the given child window on the MetroWindow dialog container in an asynchronous way. When the dialog was closed it returns a result.
member.param: The owning window with a container of the child window.
member.exception: The provided child window can not add, the container can not be found. or The provided child window is already visible in the specified window.

member.name: M:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.ShowChildWindowAsync(System.Windows.Window,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindow,System.Windows.Controls.Panel)
member.summary: Shows the given child window on the given container in an asynchronous way. When the dialog was closed it returns a result.
member.param: The owning window with a container of the child window.
member.exception: The provided child window can not add, there is no container defined. or The provided child window is already visible in the specified window.

member.name: M:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindowManager.ShowChildWindowAsync``1(System.Windows.Window,MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.ChildWindow,System.Windows.Controls.Panel)
member.summary: Shows the given child window on the given container in an asynchronous way.
member.param: The owning window with a container of the child window.
member.exception: The provided child window can not add, there is no container defined. or The provided child window is already visible in the specified window.

member.name: T:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.Utils.SingletonBase`1
member.summary:
To recap, in order to create a singleton class using the singleton base class, you need to do the following:
1) Define a sealed class which derives from SingletonBase[T], where T is the class name you are defining. It ensures that you cannot create subclasses from this singleton class. 2) Define a single parameterless private constructor inside the class. It ensures that no instances of this class can be created externally. 3) Access the classâ€™ singleton instance and public members by calling the Instance property.
got this implementation from http://liquidsilver.codeplex.com http://codebender.denniland.com/a-singleton-base-class-to-implement-the-singleton-pattern-in-c/
also show http://www.yoda.arachsys.com/csharp/singleton.html

member.name: M:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.Utils.SingletonBase`1.#ctor
member.summary: A protected constructor which is accessible only to the sub classes.

member.name: P:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.Utils.SingletonBase`1.Instance
member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of this class.

member.name: T:MahApps.Metro.SimpleChildWindow.Utils.SingletonBase`1.SingletonFactory
member.summary: The singleton class factory to create the singleton instance.
